TaxonIdentification.subspecies_authority: (H. F. Lewis & Epling) M. J. Warnock

treatment.description: Roots usually more than 10 cm. Stems 30-90 cm. Leaves mostly on proximal 1/3 of stem; basal leaves usually present at anthesis; blade with ultimate lobes 3-20, width less than 4 mm. Inflorescences: bracteoles 3-6 mm. Flowers: sepals usually reflexed, lateral sepals 7-11 mm, spurs 10-13 mm; lower petal blades 3-5 mm. 2n = 16.
treatment.habitat: Dry chaparral, sage scrub and lower montane woods
treatment.discussion: Delphinium parryi subsp. purpureum may be imperiled by human encroachment.

This taxon may be confused with Delphinium parishii, but its abundant arched hairs and lack of wider-lobed basal leaves will distinguish D. parryi subsp. purpureum. It hybridizes with D. parishii subsp. pallidum.
